exclusion:
Put controller in exclusion mode.

Remove cover from device and press button 3 times rapidly.
inclusion:
Put controller in inclusion mode.

Remove cover from device, remove tab from battery (if present), and press button 3 times rapidly.
label: DMWS1
overview: The Dome Leak Sensor is a battery powered Z-Wave Plus device that can detect wetness and send a notification when it does so. The Leak Sensor consists of two parts—the “SENSOR ASSEMBLY,” and the optional “REMOTE SENSOR PROBE.” They both detect water similarly, using three visible “LEAD.” The moment water touches any of the LEAD, the device will beep and send a notification with its moisture status to its Z-Wave controller.
wakeup: Remove cover from device, then press and hold the button for two seconds. The LED INDICATOR will flash once indicating successful wake up. If this doesn't wake up the device, try triple-clicking the button. This causes the device to emit a NIF frame, which the binding treats as a wake up.

channels.name: sensor_binary
channels.label: Binary Sensor
channels.overview:
The Leak Sensor also sends a Binary Sensor Report when a leak is detected or removed.  See below for the SENSOR_BINARY_REPORT parameters sent:
Sensor Type: 06 (Water)
Leak Detected Value: 0xFF
Leak Removed Value: 0x00

parameters.label: Total Alarm Duration
parameters.description: Total time the Leak Sensor will beep and light its LED in the event of a leak
parameters.overview:
0: Leak Sensor beeps until water is removed

1-255: 1-255 minutes

parameters.label: Mute Time
parameters.description: Quiet time between each Reminder Alarm

parameters.label: Initial Alarm
parameters.description: Time the Leak Sensor beeps before it is muted

parameters.label: Reminder Alarm
parameters.description: Length of each beep after the Initial Alarm

parameters.label: Enable/Disable Audible Alarm
parameters.description: Enables or disables the audible alarm (“beeping”)

parameters.label: Enable/Disable Water Detection
parameters.description: If disabled, the device will not respond in any way to detected leaks.

parameters.label: Basic Set Level
parameters.description: The value sent by the BASIC_SET command to Association Group 2
parameters.overview: Determines the value to be sent in the Basic Set command to Association Group 2 when a leak is detected

associations.label: Lifeline
associations.overview: Group 1 is the “Lifeline” group, which can hold five members, typically including the main Z-Wave controller.  The Leak Sensor sends this group a Notification Report and a Binary Sensor Report when water is detected or removed.  It also sends this group a Battery Report in reponse to Battery Get commands and a Locally Reset Notification upon local reset.

associations.label: Control
associations.description: Group to receive BASIC_SET on leak change
associations.overview: The Leak Sensor sends a Basic Set command to Association Group 2 (or the Control Group) to directly trigger devices (like a light, chime, etc.) in response to a detected leak. Then, after the leak is no longer detected, a BASIC_SET(0x00) command is sent to reset the device (e.g. turn off the light.) The value of the Basic Set command (e.g. brightness of the lamp) is configured using configuration parameter 7.

associations.label: Notification
associations.overview: Group 3 supports up to 5 members and the Leak Sensor sends it a NOTIFICATION_REPORT when water is detected or removed

associations.label: Sensor Binary
associations.overview: Group 4 supports up to 5 members and the Leak Sensor sends it a SENSOR_BINARY_REPORT when water is detected or removed.

documents.label: Operating Guide and ZWave command reference
